message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you our premium product. It's truly exceptional and I believe it could greatly benefit your business. Given its value, I propose a price of $14000 for it.
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $12000. I believe that's a fair price considering the value you've mentioned.
Thank you for your interest, Bob. I appreciate your input and I understand your perspective. Considering the unique value this product offers, I would like to counter with an offer of $13500.
I appreciate your flexibility, Alice, but I'm still not convinced that $13500 is the right price. I'm willing to meet you halfway at $13000, but that's as high as I'm willing to go.
I see where you're coming from, Bob. Let me try one last time to bridge the gap. How about we settle on $13250 for the product? This is my final offer.
I appreciate your persistence, Alice, but I'm afraid $13250 is still a bit too high for me. I'm willing to meet you at $13000, as I mentioned earlier. I'm not willing to go any higher.
Understood, Bob. Let's try to find common ground. I'll offer $13125 for the product. I hope this proposal is acceptable.
I appreciate your continued effort to find a mutually agreeable price, Alice. However, I'm still at $13000. I'm not willing to go any higher.
I see, Bob. Let me think about this one more time. I'll make you a final offer of $13100 for the product. I hope this works for you.
Alice, I appreciate your persistence, but I'm afraid I've reached my limit. I'm willing to meet you at $13000, which is the price I was thinking of from the start. I hope we can agree on this price.
